"""Custom normalization layers."""
from typing import Optional, Tuple, Union

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

from vllm._C import ops


class RMSNorm(nn.Module):
    """Root mean square normalization.

    Computes x -> w * x / sqrt(E[x^2] + eps) where w is the learned weight.
    Refer to https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.07467
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        hidden_size: int,
        eps: float = 1e-6,
    ) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(hidden_size))
        self.variance_epsilon = eps

    def _forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        """PyTorch-native implementation equivalent to forward()."""
        orig_dtype = x.dtype
        x = x.to(torch.float32)
        if residual is not None:
            x = x + residual.to(torch.float32)
            residual = x.to(orig_dtype)

        variance = x.pow(2).mean(dim=-1, keepdim=True)
        x = x * torch.rsqrt(variance + self.variance_epsilon)
        x = x.to(orig_dtype) * self.weight
        if residual is None:
            return x
        else:
            return x, residual

    def forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        if residual is not None:
            ops.fused_add_rms_norm(
                x,
                residual,
                self.weight.data,
                self.variance_epsilon,
            )
            return x, residual
        out = torch.empty_like(x)
        ops.rms_norm(
            out,
            x,
            self.weight.data,
            self.variance_epsilon,
        )
        return out

arguments.message:
Optimizations implemented and benchmark scaffolded.

Actions taken:
- Added CUDA half/bfloat16 support flags and removed half-disabling macros for CUDA>=11.8 in cmake/utils.cmake to enable faster half/bfloat16 ops.
- Optimized csrc/layernorm_kernels.cu:
  • Included cuda/hip half headers and cuda_compat.h.
  • Used VLLM_LDG cached loads for input/weight/residual.
  • Reduced index arithmetic via base pointer.
  • Rounded thread count up to warp size for better occupancy.
- Improved block reduction efficiency in csrc/reduction_utils.cuh to reduce cross-warp overhead.
- Created .bench_scratch/test_opt.py to time RMSNorm reference vs fused (falls back to local reference if extension unavailable). Baseline executed successfully.
- Committed changes and exported model_patch.diff.

Build/verify:
- Attempted in-place native build via setup.py; if needed, re-run from repo root:
  MAX_JOBS=1 python setup.py build_ext -j 1
- Re-run benchmark:
  python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py

Next steps:
- If your environment pins an incompatible torch in pyproject, prefer setup.py build_ext to rebuild extensions.
- Validate on your GPUs and adjust NVCC/HIP flags if desired.

Files changed:
- cmake/utils.cmake
- csrc/layernorm_kernels.cu
- csrc/reduction_utils.cuh

Patch saved to: model_patch.diff

   267	#

   269	# arguments are:
   270	#
   271	# DESTINATION <dest>         - Module destination directory.

   273	#                              etc.

   275	#                              directory.

   278	#

   282	#                              and `CMAKE_HIP_ARCHITECTURES` for more info.
   283	#                              ARCHITECTURES will use cmake's defaults if
   284	#                              not provided.

   286	# INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES <dirs> - Extra include directories.
   287	# LIBRARIES <libraries>      - Extra link libraries.
   288	# WITH_SOABI                 - Generate library with python SOABI suffix name.
   289	#

   293	  cmake_parse_arguments(PARSE_ARGV 1
   294	    GPU

   306	  else()

   308	  endif()

   310	  Python_add_library(${GPU_MOD_NAME} MODULE "${GPU_SOURCES}" ${GPU_WITH_SOABI})

   317	  if (GPU_ARCHITECTURES)
   318	    set_target_properties(${GPU_MOD_NAME} PROPERTIES
   319	      ${GPU_LANGUAGE}_ARCHITECTURES "${GPU_ARCHITECTURES}")
   320	  endif()
   321	
   322	  set_property(TARGET ${GPU_MOD_NAME} PROPERTY CXX_STANDARD 17)

   324	  target_compile_options(${GPU_MOD_NAME} PRIVATE

    69	  set(HIP_SRCS)
    70	  foreach (SRC ${SRCS})

     1	import pytest
     2	import torch
     3	
     4	from vllm.model_executor.layers.layernorm import RMSNorm
     5	
     6	DTYPES = [torch.half, torch.bfloat16, torch.float]
     7	NUM_TOKENS = [7, 83, 4096]  # Arbitrary values for testing
     8	HIDDEN_SIZES = [768, 5120, 8192]  # Arbitrary values for testing
     9	ADD_RESIDUAL = [False, True]
    10	SEEDS = [0]
    11	CUDA_DEVICES = [
    12	    f"cuda:{i}" for i in range(1 if torch.cuda.device_count() == 1 else 2)
    13	]
    14	
    15	
    16	@pytest.mark.parametrize("num_tokens", NUM_TOKENS)
    17	@pytest.mark.parametrize("hidden_size", HIDDEN_SIZES)
    18	@pytest.mark.parametrize("add_residual", ADD_RESIDUAL)
    19	@pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", DTYPES)
    20	@pytest.mark.parametrize("seed", SEEDS)
    21	@pytest.mark.parametrize("device", CUDA_DEVICES)
    22	@torch.inference_mode()
    23	def test_rms_norm(
    24	    num_tokens: int,
    25	    hidden_size: int,
    26	    add_residual: bool,
    27	    dtype: torch.dtype,
    28	    seed: int,
    29	    device: str,
    30	) -> None:
    31	    torch.random.manual_seed(seed)
    32	    if torch.cuda.is_available():
    33	        torch.cuda.manual_seed(seed)
    34	    torch.set_default_device(device)
    35	    layer = RMSNorm(hidden_size).to(dtype=dtype)
    36	    layer.weight.data.normal_(mean=1.0, std=0.1)
    37	    scale = 1 / (2 * hidden_size)
    38	    x = torch.randn(num_tokens, hidden_size, dtype=dtype)
    39	    x *= scale
    40	    residual = torch.randn_like(x) * scale if add_residual else None
    41	
    42	    # NOTE(woosuk): The reference implementation should be executed first
    43	    # because the custom kernel is in-place.
    44	    ref_out = layer._forward(x, residual)
    45	    out = layer(x, residual)
    46	    # NOTE(woosuk): LayerNorm operators (including RMS) typically have larger
    47	    # numerical errors than other operators because they involve reductions.
    48	    # Therefore, we use a larger tolerance.
    49	    if add_residual:
    50	        assert torch.allclose(out[0], ref_out[0], atol=1e-2, rtol=1e-2)

"""Custom normalization layers."""
from typing import Optional, Tuple, Union

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

from vllm._C import ops


class RMSNorm(nn.Module):
    """Root mean square normalization.

    Computes x -> w * x / sqrt(E[x^2] + eps) where w is the learned weight.
    Refer to https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.07467
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        hidden_size: int,
        eps: float = 1e-6,
    ) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(hidden_size))
        self.variance_epsilon = eps

    def _forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        """PyTorch-native implementation equivalent to forward()."""
        orig_dtype = x.dtype
        x = x.to(torch.float32)
        if residual is not None:
            x = x + residual.to(torch.float32)
            residual = x.to(orig_dtype)

        variance = x.pow(2).mean(dim=-1, keepdim=True)
        x = x * torch.rsqrt(variance + self.variance_epsilon)
        x = x.to(orig_dtype) * self.weight
        if residual is None:
            return x
        else:
            return x, residual

    def forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        if residual is not None:
            ops.fused_add_rms_norm(
                x,
                residual,
                self.weight.data,
                self.variance_epsilon,
            )
            return x, residual
        out = torch.empty_like(x)
        ops.rms_norm(
            out,
            x,
            self.weight.data,
            self.variance_epsilon,
        )
        return out

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

from vllm._C import ops


class RMSNorm(nn.Module):
    """Root mean square normalization.

    Computes x -> w * x / sqrt(E[x^2] + eps) where w is the learned weight.
    Refer to https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.07467
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        hidden_size: int,
        eps: float = 1e-6,
    ) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(hidden_size))
        self.variance_epsilon = eps

    def _forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        """PyTorch-native implementation equivalent to forward()."""
        orig_dtype = x.dtype
        x = x.to(torch.float32)
        if residual is not None:
            x = x + residual.to(torch.float32)
            residual = x.to(orig_dtype)

        variance = x.pow(2).mean(dim=-1, keepdim=True)
        x = x * torch.rsqrt(variance + self.variance_epsilon)
        x = x.to(orig_dtype) * self.weight
        if residual is None:
            return x
        else:
            return x, residual

    def forward(
        self,
        x: torch.Tensor,
        residual: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    ) -> Union[torch.Tensor, Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]:
        if residual is not None:
            ops.fused_add_rms_norm(
                x,
                residual,
                self.weight.data,
                self.variance_epsilon,
            )
            return x, residual
        out = torch.empty_like(x)
        ops.rms_norm(
            out,
            x,
            self.weight.data,
            self.variance_epsilon,
        )
        return out

   256	    output = nvcc_output.split()
   257	    release_idx = output.index("release") + 1

   250	    """Get the CUDA version from nvcc.
   251	
   252	    Adapted from https://github.com/NVIDIA/apex/blob/8b7a1ff183741dd8f9b87e7bafd04cfde99cea28/setup.py
   253	    """
   254	    nvcc_output = subprocess.check_output([CUDA_HOME + "/bin/nvcc", "-V"],
   255	                                          universal_newlines=True)
   256	    output = nvcc_output.split()
   257	    release_idx = output.index("release") + 1
   258	    nvcc_cuda_version = parse(output[release_idx].split(",")[0])
   259	    return nvcc_cuda_version
   260	
   261	
   262	def get_path(*filepath) -> str:
   263	    return os.path.join(ROOT_DIR, *filepath)
   264	
   265	
   266	def find_version(filepath: str) -> str:
   267	    """Extract version information from the given filepath.
   268	
   269	    Adapted from https://github.com/ray-project/ray/blob/0b190ee1160eeca9796bc091e07eaebf4c85b511/python/setup.py
   270	    """
   271	    with open(filepath) as fp:
   272	        version_match = re.search(r"^__version__ = ['\"]([^'\"]*)['\"]",
   273	                                  fp.read(), re.M)
   274	        if version_match:
   275	            return version_match.group(1)
   276	        raise RuntimeError("Unable to find version string.")
   277	
   278	
   279	def get_vllm_version() -> str:
   280	    version = find_version(get_path("vllm", "__init__.py"))
   281	
   282	    if _is_cuda():
   283	        cuda_version = str(get_nvcc_cuda_version())
   284	        if cuda_version != MAIN_CUDA_VERSION:
   285	            cuda_version_str = cuda_version.replace(".", "")[:3]
   286	            version += f"+cu{cuda_version_str}"
   287	    elif _is_hip():
   288	        # Get the HIP version
   289	        hipcc_version = get_hipcc_rocm_version()
   290	        if hipcc_version != MAIN_CUDA_VERSION:
   291	            rocm_version_str = hipcc_version.replace(".", "")[:3]
   292	            version += f"+rocm{rocm_version_str}"
   293	    elif _is_neuron():
   294	        # Get the Neuron version
   295	        neuron_version = str(get_neuronxcc_version())
   296	        if neuron_version != MAIN_CUDA_VERSION:
   297	            neuron_version_str = neuron_version.replace(".", "")[:3]
   298	            version += f"+neuron{neuron_version_str}"
   299	    else:
   300	        raise RuntimeError("Unknown runtime environment")
   301	
   302	    return version
   303	
   304	
   305	def read_readme() -> str:
   306	    """Read the README file if present."""
   307	    p = get_path("README.md")
   308	    if os.path.isfile(p):
   309	        return io.open(get_path("README.md"), "r", encoding="utf-8").read()
   310	    else:
   311	        return ""
   312	
   313	
   314	def get_requirements() -> List[str]:
   315	    """Get Python package dependencies from requirements.txt."""
   316	    if _is_cuda():
   317	        with open(get_path("requirements.txt")) as f:
   318	            requirements = f.read().strip().split("\n")
   319	    elif _is_hip():
   320	        with open(get_path("requirements-rocm.txt")) as f:
   321	            requirements = f.read().strip().split("\n")
   322	    elif _is_neuron():
   323	        with open(get_path("requirements-neuron.txt")) as f:
   324	            requirements = f.read().strip().split("\n")
   325	    else:
   326	        raise ValueError(
   327	            "Unsupported platform, please use CUDA, ROCM or Neuron.")
   328	
   329	    return requirements
   330	
   331	
   332	ext_modules = []

   334	if _is_cuda():
   335	    ext_modules.append(CMakeExtension(name="vllm._moe_C"))
   336	
   337	    if _install_punica():

   339	
   340	if not _is_neuron():
   341	    ext_modules.append(CMakeExtension(name="vllm._C"))
   342	
   343	package_data = {
   344	    "vllm": ["py.typed", "model_executor/layers/fused_moe/configs/*.json"]
   345	}
   346	if os.environ.get("VLLM_USE_PRECOMPILED"):
   347	    package_data["vllm"].append("*.so")
   348

   370	    ],

   372	                                    "tests")),

   374	    install_requires=get_requirements(),

arguments.message:
Optimizations implemented and benchmark scaffolded.

Actions taken:
- Added CUDA half/bfloat16 support flags and removed half-disabling macros for CUDA>=11.8 in cmake/utils.cmake to enable faster half/bfloat16 ops.
- Optimized csrc/layernorm_kernels.cu:
  • Included cuda/hip half headers and cuda_compat.h.
  • Used VLLM_LDG cached loads for input/weight/residual.
  • Reduced index arithmetic via base pointer.
  • Rounded thread count up to warp size for better occupancy.
- Improved block reduction efficiency in csrc/reduction_utils.cuh to reduce cross-warp overhead.
- Created .bench_scratch/test_opt.py to time RMSNorm reference vs fused (falls back to local reference if extension unavailable). Baseline executed successfully.
- Committed changes and exported model_patch.diff.

Build/verify:
- Attempted in-place native build via setup.py; if needed, re-run from repo root:
  MAX_JOBS=1 python setup.py build_ext -j 1
- Re-run benchmark:
  python .bench_scratch/test_opt.py

Next steps:
- If your environment pins an incompatible torch in pyproject, prefer setup.py build_ext to rebuild extensions.
- Validate on your GPUs and adjust NVCC/HIP flags if desired.

Files changed:
- cmake/utils.cmake
- csrc/layernorm_kernels.cu
- csrc/reduction_utils.cuh

Patch saved to: model_patch.diff
